author: AstroDevam
title: Libra, Horoscope Today, June 1, 2024: Your sociable nature is heightened - Times of India
text: Libra, as June 1st, 2024, unfolds, you will find harmony and balance, which are always crucial to your well-being, taking center stage. The Sun in Gemini forms a pleasant aspect with your ruling planet Venus, enhancing your social interactions and making this day particularly favorable for engaging with others in peaceful and artistic settings.Your sociable nature is heightened, making it a perfect day for networking, catching up with friends, or meeting new people. Your charm and diplomacy will win you favor in social circles, potentially opening doors to new opportunities. If you've been considering hosting an event or gathering, today would be an ideal time to bring people together and create lasting connections.In matters of the heart, this harmonious day brings a gentle and romantic vibe. For those in relationships, itâ€™s an excellent opportunity to express your love and appreciation for your partner. Plan a special outing or a quiet evening together. For single Libras, your natural allure is amplified, making it an opportune time to attract someone with similar values and interests.On the career front, your sense of fairness and ability to see multiple perspectives shines, particularly in team settings or in negotiations. If there are conflicts or decisions that require a balanced approach, youâ€™re well equipped to guide discussions to a constructive resolution. Today also favors artistic or creative pursuits; your aesthetic sense is keen, making it a good time to delve into projects that require a good eye and tasteful touch.Health-wise, focus on maintaining equilibrium. Engage in activities that help balance your mental and physical energies, such as yoga or meditation. Given the social nature of the day, ensure that you also find time to retreat and recharge on your own, as maintaining your inner peace is just as important as your interactions with the outside world.Overall, June 1st, 2024, promises to be a day of pleasant engagements and creative expression for you, Libra. Embrace the opportunities to harmonize and beautify both your environment and your relationships, keeping in mind your need for balance in all things.

author: Lisa Parker
title: Global Learning Charter Public School Announces 22 Students Inducted Into The National Honor Society
text:
The Global Learning Charter Public School (GLCPS), a tuition-free public charter school that currently serves 500 students in grades 5-12, today announced that twenty-two students have been inducted into the National Honor Society.
The inducted students who will graduate in 2024 include Thomas Lacerte-Kirby, Natalie Texeira and Nevaeh Tucker. Graduates from the class of 2025 include Veronika Horsky, Benjamin Moniz, Vanessa Pereira, Vanhelsig Reyes, Ivette Terrero, Mariah Tono and Bella Ventura. Inductees from the class of 2026 include Jaslin Arita, Shalom Casanova, Ezven Cruz, Alikka Espinola, Noah Galarza, Eyden Gonzalez Panjoj, Lessy Guerra-Lopez, Serena Houtman, Dhruv Patel, Yaraliz Perez, Mariana Ribeiro, and Cristian Rivera.
The National Honor Society (NHS) is one of the oldest, largest, and most widely recognized co-curricular student organizations in American high schools. The purpose the NHS is to create enthusiasm for scholarship, to stimulate a desire to render service, to promote leadership, and to develop character in the students of secondary schools.
Membership in local NHS chapters is an honor bestowed upon a student by a Faculty Council and is based on the four pillars of NHS: scholarship, character, leadership, and service. Once selected, members have the responsibility to continue to demonstrate these qualities.
â€œWe are so proud of the achievements of this group of excellent students,â€ said Dr. Stephen Furtado, Executive Director of GLCPS. â€œTheir character leadership and service to the community lift all of us up to a higher level. Their enthusiasm for education creates an environment of learning for all of our students.â€
Open to New Bedford residents, Global Learning Charter Public School is a tuition-free public school that serves students in grades 5-12. GLCPS offers a small, personalized learning environment in which students are encouraged to realize their full potential, both academically and personally.
For more information, please visit www.glcps.org or call 508-991-4105.
For media inquiries or further information, please contact Lynn Poyant at (508) 991-4105 or lpoyant@glcps.org .
The Global Learning Charter Public School is open to all students on a space available basis and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, creed or religion, sex, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, housing status, mental or physical disability, age, ancestry, athletic performance, special need, proficiency in the English language or a foreign language, or prior academic achievement.

author: Giorgia Bonamoneta
title: Papa Francesco si dimette? La rivelazione del cardinale Ravasi dopo il ricovero di Bergoglio al Gemelli
text:
Papa Francesco si dimette? La rivelazione del cardinale Ravasi dopo il ricovero di Bergoglio al Gemelli
Papa Francesco Ã¨ ricoverato al Gemelli e nomina un nuovo vescovo. Il cardinale Ravasi ipotizza le dimissioni. Cosa sta succedendo
Papa Francesco Ã¨ ricoverato al Gemelli per una polmonite bilaterale. Le sue condizioni sono stazionarie, ma destano preoccupazione vista lâ€™etÃ  avanzata. Il cardinale Gianfranco Ravasi ha dichiarato che il Pontefice potrebbe dimettersi se le sue condizioni fisiche gli impedissero di mantenere il contatto diretto con i fedeli. Intanto, Bergoglio nomina un vescovo.
Come sta Papa Francesco
Papa Francesco Ã¨ ricoverato al Policlinico Gemelli da 6 giorni a causa di una polmonite bilaterale. Le sue condizioni vengono descritte come stazionarie, con piccoli miglioramenti, ma i medici mantengono una certa cautela vista lâ€™etÃ  avanzata di 88 anni.
Non Ã¨ ancora noto quando sarÃ  dimesso dallâ€™ospedale e lâ€™incertezza sul recupero completo ha alimentato ipotesi su un possibile passo indietro dal pontificato.
Papa Francesco a lavoro: nomina un vescovo
Il cardinale Gianfranco Ravasi ha parlato di â€œcauto ottimismoâ€ riguardo al decorso clinico, evidenziando che Francesco Ã¨ un uomo abituato a combattere e che in passato ha affrontato situazioni altrettanto difficili.
Le parole del cardinale Ravasi
Il cardinale Gianfranco Ravasi ha sollevato pubblicamente la possibilitÃ  che Papa Francesco possa dimettersi dal pontificato se le sue condizioni fisiche gli impedissero di mantenere un contatto diretto con i fedeli. Ravasi ha dichiarato: â€œIo penso che possa farlo, perchÃ© Ã¨ una persona abbastanza decisa nelle sue scelteâ€.
Secondo Ravasi, Bergoglio Ã¨ una persona che â€œgoverna con il cervelloâ€, ma se la sua capacitÃ  comunicativa dovesse risultare gravemente limitata, potrebbe prendere in considerazione lâ€™ipotesi di un passo indietro.
Il cardinale ha anche ricordato che Papa Francesco ha giÃ  predisposto una lettera di dimissioni nel caso in cui un peggioramento delle sue condizioni fisiche gli impedisse di svolgere le sue funzioni.
Nominato un vescovo: chi Ã¨
Nonostante il ricovero, Papa Francesco ha continuato a svolgere le sue attivitÃ  di governo della Chiesa Cattolica. Durante la degenza al Gemelli, il Pontefice ha nominato un nuovo vescovo.
Il nuovo vescovo nominato Ã¨ FranÃ§ois Gourdon, del clero della Diocesi di Angers. Fino ad oggi, Gourdon Ã¨ stato parroco della Cattedrale di Angers e decano di Angers-Centre. Ora Ã¨ stato designato come Vescovo di Saint-DiÃ©, in Francia. La nomina Ã¨ stata comunicata ufficialmente dalla Sala stampa vaticana.

author: WeatherBrains
title: Much Needed Snow for Utah | Good Conditions for the Next 10+ Days
text: Forecast prepared around 10:00 Jan 3, 2024 Forecast Summary A series of storms will bring snow to the entire U.S. West over the next ~10 days. This is welcome news, as most of the West is [well below normal snowpack](https://snowbrains.com/the-state-of-the-snowpack-hope-for-more-snow-in-2024/) for this time of year. The authorâ€™s last pow turns were almost a month ago on December 9th â€“ unacceptable, frankly. About time for some new snow! There are four storms for Utah skiers/riders to watch in the next week. Two small ones coming Thursday and Friday night, with two somewhat bigger storms arriving Sunday-Monday and again Wednesday-Thursday (the 10th-11th). Short Term Storm #1 will primarily impact Southern Utah (see above), bringing a few inches of snow to Brian Head and Eagle Point Wednesday night. Despite the southern track, some scraps will make it as far north as the Cottonwood/Park City resorts, where an inch or two of snow is likely on Thursday. Nothing too exciting, but this is just an appetizer storm. Expected new snow: - Alta/Snowbird/Solitude/Brighton: Up to 3â€³ - Park City/Deer Valley: Up to 2â€³ - Powder Mountain/Snowbasin/Beaver Mountain: <1â€³ - Brian Head/Eagle Point: 3-5â€³ Storm #2 wonâ€™t be a blockbuster either, but will further soften up the firm snow weâ€™ve been on for the past month or so. Expect mountain snow showers to increase through the afternoon on Friday with a bit of a burst of snow Friday night as a cold front moves through. This storm will bring a period of moist northwesterly winds aloft Friday evening-night, which is excellent news for skiers in the Cottonwoods. Solitude, Brighton, and especially Alta & Snowbird all do very well in these types of storms. Check it out, this map shows you whatâ€™s happening at about 10,000â€² elevation around midday Friday. Weâ€™ve got a nice blob of green (moisture) approaching and a great fetch of those sweet northwesterly winds that Cottonwoods skiers & riders should always be excited about: Expected new snow: - Alta/Snowbird/Solitude/Brighton: 5-10â€³ (possibly more if we can get some help from the lake) - Park City/Deer Valley: 2-5â€³ - Powder Mountain/Snowbasin/Beaver Mountain: 2-3â€³ - Brian Head/Eagle Point: An inch if youâ€™re lucky This Weekend and Beyond Storm #3 will be an impressive one, but I think the meatiest part of this system will dive south and west of Utah, bringing the best snow to CA, AZ, NM, & CO. You can see this nicely in model forecasts, which show a big â€˜ol trough centered over California and Nevada on Sunday morning, which then heads toward the Four Corners through Monday: If the storm track trends much further south, most of the Utah resorts probably only pull down a couple of inches from this one. If it trends a little farther north, we could be talking about a 10â€³+ storm for most of our mountains. I wonâ€™t guess which comes to pass quite yet. Storm #4 is still a while off, arriving Wednesday-Thursday of next week (Jan 10-11), but has some potential to bring a solid round of snow mostly to the northern half of the state. Itâ€™s a little early to be putting snow numbers on this storm, but something in the ballpark of 6-18â€³ seems reasonable for now. As for the rest of January, long-range forecast tools suggest we stay in a fairly active pattern. Some ensemble forecasts like the one below keep the storms coming through the 20th: Honestly, I donâ€™t put much stock into forecasts beyond a 7-10-day window. Itâ€™s just good to know we probably wonâ€™t see another totally dry period in the next couple of weeks. Iâ€™ll leave you with the CPC extended outlooks because they make me excited for the rest of the month. Happy shredding.

author: Anujj Trehaan
title: Thrilling wildlife safaris near Johannesburg
text:
Thrilling wildlife safaris near Johannesburg
Johannesburg, nestled in South Africa's heart, is a gateway to exhilarating wildlife safaris.
A short drive from the city reveals the African wilderness's untamed beauty.
These safaris provide a nature escape where majestic animals roam freely in their habitat, offering an immersive experience into the wild for nature enthusiasts eager to witness the continent's majestic wildlife up close.
Pilanesberg National Park: A volcanic haven
Just two hours from Johannesburg, Pilanesberg National Park is nestled within an ancient volcanic crater.
This unique geological structure has created a rich biodiversity, making it home to the Big Five (lion, leopard, rhinoceros, elephant, and buffalo).
The park's malaria-free status and its proximity to the city make it an ideal spot for those looking to experience
Africa's wild beauty without venturing too far.
Madikwe Game Reserve: Untouched wilderness
Bordering Botswana about three and a half hours from Johannesburg lies Madikwe Game Reserve. This hidden gem is one of South Africa's largest reserves and is renowned for its conservation efforts. It offers exceptional sightings of wild dogs and cheetahs alongside the Big Five. Its remote location ensures a more secluded safari experience, perfect for travelers seeking tranquility amidst nature.
Dinokeng Game Reserve: Where giants roam
A mere hour's drive north of Johannesburg brings you to Dinokeng Game Reserveâ€”the first free-roaming Big Five game reserve next to an urbanized area. It provides visitors with the unique opportunity to see elephants, lions, leopards, rhinos, and buffaloes near a major city. The reserve also offers self-drive routes for those who prefer exploring at their own pace.
Waterberg Biosphere: A birdwatcher's paradise
Three hours north of Johannesburg, the Waterberg Biosphere Reserve is a
UNESCO site known for its spectacular landscapes and diverse ecosystems.
Lesser-known compared to other safari destinations, it offers intimate wildlife encounters, including over 300 bird species.
Ideal for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts, Waterberg provides a unique window into South Africa's rich wildlife heritage, promising unforgettable experiences just a short journey from Johannesburg.

author: /autor/leysa-caro-gonzalez/
title: A cuatro aÃ±os de los terremotos, director ejecutivo del COR3 ve â€œun mayor progreso y tracciÃ³n durante los pasados dos aÃ±osâ€ - El Nuevo DÃ­a
text: A cuatro aÃ±os de [aquella madrugada en que el paÃ­s se despertÃ³ a causa de un terremoto de 6.4 grados de intensidad](https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/locales/notas/un-terremoto-de-magnitud-64-sacude-a-puerto-rico-en-la-madrugada-del-martes/), siguen siendo mÃºltiples los retos que enfrenta la zona para recuperarse, pero, aun asÃ­, el director ejecutivo de la [Oficina Central de RecuperaciÃ³n, ReconstrucciÃ³n y Resiliencia (COR3,](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/cor3/) por sus siglas en inglÃ©s), [Manuel Laboy](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/manuel-laboy/), apuntÃ³ a â€œun mayor progresoâ€ en los proyectos pendientes. â€œCiertamente, los primeros dos aÃ±os tuvieron muchos retos que se han ido superando, incluyendo el hecho de estar manejando mÃºltiples desastres como los huracanes Irma y MarÃ­a, la pandemia del COVID-19 y mÃ¡s reciente, el huracÃ¡n Fiona. No obstante, vemos un mayor progreso y tracciÃ³n durante los pasados dos aÃ±os debido a las iniciativas que hemos implementado a favor de sus proyectosâ€, asegurÃ³ Laboy. La [Agencia Federal para el Manejo de Emergencias (FEMA](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/fema/), por sus siglas en inglÃ©s), dijo, ha obligado $913 millones para apoyar la recuperaciÃ³n de la zona, lo que ha permitido darle paso a mÃºltiples proyectos, como la reconstrucciÃ³n del estadio Francisco â€œPaquitoâ€ Montaner de Ponce, la cual se completÃ³, y del parque de pelota Luis â€œPeguiâ€ Mercado y la pista atlÃ©tica Lucas Sievens. El ingeniero indicÃ³ que, actualmente, hay 284 instalaciones con obligaciones que ascienden a $105.3 millones. Para el Municipio de [GuÃ¡nica](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/guanica/), uno de los mÃ¡s afectados de la zona, se obligaron $4.1 para el desarrollo de un nuevo proyecto en el espacio donde ubicaba la casa alcaldÃ­a. Mientras, en febrero debe iniciarse la demoliciÃ³n del estadio Roberto Alberdeston, a travÃ©s de una inversiÃ³n de FEMA que ronda los $2.6 millones. De igual modo, los municipios de PeÃ±uelas, Guayanilla, GuÃ¡nica y Yauco han logrado completar 202 demoliciones de un total de 295 propiedades privadas que fueron identificadas bajo el programa de FEMA conocido como RemociÃ³n de Escombros de Propiedad Privada (PPDR, por sus siglas en inglÃ©s). AdemÃ¡s de las obras que se desarrollan en los municipios, las dependencias gubernamentales trabajan en la rehabilitaciÃ³n de las propiedades del estado que resultaron con daÃ±os. Entre estas, estÃ¡ un tanque de almacenaje de agua en la comunidad de Alturas BÃ©lgica de Yauco, mediante una inversiÃ³n de $2.5 millones. Entretanto, el [Instituto de la Cultura PuertorriqueÃ±a (ICP) ](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/instituto-de-cultura-puertorriquena/)comenzarÃ¡ este trimestre los trabajos de ingenierÃ­a y arquitectura del Centro Ceremonial Caguana, en Utuado, y del Museo de la MÃºsica, en Ponce. TambiÃ©n en la Ciudad SeÃ±orial, el ICP se apresta a seleccionar la firma que se encargarÃ¡ de la reconstrucciÃ³n del Museo de la Masacre de Ponce. Otros proyectos que se desarrollan en la â€œPerla de Surâ€, son el Museo de Arte de Ponce, el Centro Sor Isolina FerrÃ© y la Iglesia Metodista de la ResurrecciÃ³n. Algunos de estos proyectos conllevan estudios estructurales, de arqueologÃ­a, el diseÃ±o de planos o reparaciones estructurales, entre otros procesos, detallÃ³ el funcionario. EnseÃ±anza pÃºblica Laboy afirmÃ³, ademÃ¡s, que FEMA ha obligado $276 millones para la rehabilitaciÃ³n de 148 de las 149 escuelas del [Departamento de EducaciÃ³n ](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/departamento-de-educacion/)que reportaron daÃ±os. En paralelo, EducaciÃ³n completÃ³, a travÃ©s de la [Autoridad para el Financiamiento de la Infraestructura (AFI),](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/autoridad-para-el-financiamiento-de-la-infraestructura-afi/) cinco de seis planteles escolares temporeros (modulares), gracias a una inversiÃ³n de $50 millones en fondos de FEMA. â€œTenemos como norte el agilizar la reconstrucciÃ³n, pero no podemos comprometer la buena planificaciÃ³n que realizan las agencias gubernamentales, los municipios y las entidades sin fines de lucro para determinar si se debe reparar, restaurar o reemplazar una estructura con daÃ±os ocasionados por terremotos, en particular, porque hay que cumplir con los requisitos federales de preservaciÃ³n histÃ³rica y cumplimiento ambientalâ€, declarÃ³ Laboy Rivera. Por otra parte, el director ejecutivo de COR3, revelÃ³ que, a partir de este lunes el gobierno pondrÃ¡ a disposiciÃ³n de los municipios $12.5 millones de fondos estatales para que puedan pagar el 10% correspondiente al pareo del dinero asignado por FEMA para los proyectos de obra permanente. Esta partida -que inicialmente ascendÃ­a a $10 millones- originalmente se habÃ­a dispuesto para los proyectos de reconstrucciÃ³n del huracÃ¡n Fiona, pero se incluyeron las obras permanentes de los terremotos. â€œEsta iniciativa continuarÃ¡ impulsando el desarrollo de los proyectos por los daÃ±os ocasionados por los terremotosâ€, manifestÃ³ Laboy Rivera. Aquellos municipios interesados en obtener estos fondos pueden tramitar la solicitud a travÃ©s del correo electrÃ³nico [municipality.costshare@cor3.pr.gov](mailto:municipality.costshare@cor3.pr.gov). [ðŸ’¬Ver comentarios] - âŽ™

author: camilajarsunn
title: Â«Era un psicÃ³pata infielÂ»: Soledad Silveyra se animÃ³ a contar la verdad sobre su romance mÃ¡s polÃ©mico
text:
No hay dudas de que Soledad Silveyra es una de las actrices mÃ¡s queridas del mundo del espectÃ¡culo, y es que no solo es sumamente profesional en lo que hace, sino que ademÃ¡s es transparente con el pÃºblico a la hora de hablar de su vida privada. AsÃ­ sucediÃ³ en una reciente entrevista, en la que la actriz hablÃ³ de su pasado amoroso.
Invitada a Ãngel Responde , el ciclo de streaming que Ãngel de Brito conduce para Bondi Live, Soledad Silveyra se abriÃ³ como nunca sobre su relaciÃ³n con Chacho Ãlvarez . Aunque para muchos se tratÃ³ de una apasionada historia de amor, para la actriz el romance con el polÃ­tico fue un Â«calvarioÂ» y un Â«episodio doloroso y complejoÂ».
â€œEs el Ãºnico de los hombres que tuve, que no fueron tantos, con el que no pude quedar bien, con un vÃ­nculo mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de lo amorosoÂ», contÃ³ Soledad Silveyra sobre por quÃ© no pudo mantener su amistad con el Chacho Ãlvarez . Aunque la actriz describiÃ³ al ex vicepresidente de Fernando de la RÃºa como Â«honestoÂ», tambiÃ©n asegurÃ³ que era un Â«psicÃ³pataÂ».
â€œSufrÃ­a porque era un poco psicÃ³pata. Siempre encontraba algo; una bombachita, un corpiÃ±ito, un pincelâ€¦ y tenÃ­a unas hijas maravillosas que lo cubrÃ­an. Con Ã©l me retirÃ©. Dije â€˜basta, no quiero sufrir mÃ¡sâ€™. Era un infiel. Me la traguÃ© de que habÃ­a dejado a su novia. Â¿QuiÃ©n no ha sido cornuda alguna vez?â€, le dijo Soledad Silveyra a Ãngel de Brito.
Soledad Silveyra y su nuevo amor Recientemente Soledad Silveyra iniciÃ³ un romance con un hombre que conociÃ³ en Buzios, Brasil , JosÃ© Luis VÃ¡zquez . Invitada a la mesa de Mirtha Legrand , la actrizcontÃ³: â€œConocÃ­ un hombre encantador que vive en Brasil pero es argentino. Vive en Buzios. Estaba ahÃ­ y me habÃ­an recomendado dos amigos, y me mandan tipo encomiendaÂ».
Â«Ellos saben que yo pierdo todo, que soy un desastre, dejo todo en cualquier lado, pierdo carteras, pierdo todo. Y me encomiendanâ€¦ â€˜si les pasa algo, estÃ©n atentos, llaman a tres o cuatro contactosâ€™.Uno de esos contactos me llama al dÃ­a siguiente y me invita a almorzar. Fui a almorzar, y no habÃ­a hombre que me gustaraÂ», relatÃ³ Soledad Silveyra .
Â«Yo estaba filmando la bahÃ­a y me dicen â€˜Solitaâ€™, entonces me doy vuelta y digo â€˜ahâ€¦, mirÃ¡ vosâ€™. Y empezamos a conversar y durante ocho dÃ­as hablamos no sÃ©â€¦ diez horas por dÃ­a. Nos pasamos conversando. Me decÃ­a â€˜venite a la posadaâ€™ y yo â€˜no, noâ€™. Estaba peor que una chica de 15 aÃ±os, nerviosaâ€¦ Bueno, el Ãºltimo dÃ­a entrÃ© a la posadaâ€¦â€, agregÃ³ Solita.

author: redazione@ilgiornale-web.it (Bianca Leonardi)
title: Ricorso femminista: a Torino il Tar chiude la sala "anti aborto"
text:
Da quando ha aperto le sue porte nel maggio 2024, la stanza dell'ascolto dell'ospedale Sant'Anna di Torino (nella foto) non ha fatto che far parlare di sÃ©. Uno spazio dedicato alle donne in gravidanza, gestito dai movimenti pro vita, nato con l'obiettivo di offrire supporto, ascolto e aiuto concreto per superare quelle difficoltÃ  che potrebbero spingerle a scegliere l'aborto. Ma ora, dopo mesi di polemiche, arriva lo stop deciso: il Tar del Piemonte, con la sentenza di ieri, 2 luglio, di cui Il Giornale Ã¨ in possesso, ha annullato la convenzione firmata nel 2023 tra l'ospedale ginecologico torinese e il Centro di Aiuto alla Vita, ritenendola incompatibile con le "regole minime per attivitÃ  in contesto sanitario". La sentenza non lascia spazio a interpretazioni: "Non Ã¨ stata effettuata la verifica in concreto dei requisiti professionali, formativi e di esperienza degli operatori", si legge chiaramente nel documento, che evidenzia come la gestione affidata ai volontari pro vita non fosse in regola con certificati prettamente burocratici. A presentare il ricorso sono state associazioni femministe su tutte "Se non ora quando?" e la Cgil, che oggi festeggia la "vittoria" con entusiasmo. "La convenzione tra la CittÃ  della Salute di Torino e l'associazione che gestisce la stanza Ã¨ illegittima". E ancora: "Siamo soddisfatti per la decisione dei giudici, che hanno riconosciuto la fondatezza delle nostre ragioni contro questo progetto anti-abortista promosso dalla Regione". Ma c'Ã¨ un particolare che rischia di passare inosservato: proprio la Cgil Ã¨ stata esclusa dal ricorso dal Tar perchÃ© "il loro statuto non contempla finalitÃ  riferibili alla legge 194/1978 e alla sua applicazione". In parole semplici, il sindacato non aveva il titolo legale per opporsi su questa specifica questione, almeno secondo i giudici. Il ricorso Ã¨ stato comunque accolto, perchÃ© altri ricorrenti erano legittimati. Ma nonostante ciÃ², la segretaria piemontese della Cgil, Giorgia Mennuni, dichiara comunque: "Abbiamo contribuito a chiudere una pagina indegna, dove si tentava di dissuadere le donne dall'aborto dentro un ospedale pubblico". Stessa cosa il Partito Democratico, con la deputata Cecilia D'Elia che parla di "una vittoria per la libertÃ  delle donne e per la laicitÃ  dello Stato". Dall'altra parte, perÃ², l'assessore regionale alle Politiche sociali Maurizio Marrone non ci sta: "Il Tar non ha mai detto che la stanza dell'ascolto Ã¨ illegittima o che viola la legge 194.
Ha solo evidenziato un difetto formale, una carenza nella documentazione relativa ai requisiti dei volontari" - dichiara a Il Giornale specificando che la stanza riaprirÃ  presto, presumibilmente a settembre con una nuova convenzione che metterÃ  ordine nelle carte. "Noi non abbiamo mai disatteso la legge 194, anzi: sosteniamo le donne che scelgono di portare avanti la gravidanza, proprio come prevede la norma", conclude l'assessore. La partita, insomma, Ã¨ tutt'altro che chiusa.

Quile norme di comportamento per esteso.
